result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody R. Stachowiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Request for Expunction was denied by the court.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC.  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Cody R. Stachowiak in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER, w/Standard Release conditions);

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Madeline M.
*DNA sample/surcharge waived based on date of violation.
*Domestic Violence Counseling.
*No possession of weapons.
*Perform 100 hours community service. 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (apply cash bail, balance to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 60 Days, non working hours.  Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 6:00 p.m. on Monday, November 23, 2015.  

REQUEST FOR EXPUNCTION: DENIED BY THE COURT.
Sentencing memorandum filed by Attorney Ehrfurth.
Sentencing hearing at 11-20-2015 10:30 am
